dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 3692 IH: Stopping Cultural Marxism at the FTC Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Fitzgerald (for himself, Mr. Tiffany, and Mr. Moore of Alabama) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To require bipartisan membership in the Federal Trade Commission in order for the Commission to act following a vacancy, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stopping Cultural Marxism at the FTC Act.

The first section of the Federal Trade Commission Act (15 U.S.C. 41) is amended by striking the powers of the commission. and inserting the powers of the commission, except that, if there is more than one remaining commissioner and all of the remaining commissioners are members of the same political party (as determined at the time each commissioner was appointed to the commission by the President), the remaining commissioners may not exercise the powers of the commission..
